column4: How are com ports labeled in unix land?  Are they ttys0 and ttys1?
That is a good question.  I don't know how to tell.
I typed "ps - a" and it came back with 8312 pts/0 00:00:00 ps.  Is this good?
okay that was a silly question :(  Sorry.
How do I tell what the com ports are mapped to and if the drivers are running?
'dmesg' should show you if the drivers are loaded (and what the ports are).
Okay, I see no reference in there to tty.  Does this mean the drivers are not loaded?
indeed. I'm fairly sure 'modprobe serial' ought to load 'em.
Bad news. Module serial not found.
I checked my installed software and there doesn't appear to be any serial installed.
Maybe I need to install one of the serial module in synaptic?
